body.name: Wrong Place Wrong Time: A Reese's Book Club Pick
body.merchantInfo: Sold by gatecitybooks and Fulfilled by Amazon.
editorialReviews: Editorial Reviews Review “It’s perfection, every word, every moment. A masterpiece . . . I had my mind blown apart. After I finished it, I sat with my mouth hanging open in awe. One of the best books I’ve ever read.” — Lisa Jewell, #1 New York Times Bestselling author“A brilliantly genre-bending, mind-twisting answer to the question How far would you go to save your child?” — Ruth Ware, #1 New York Times bestselling author“Daring, inventive, exhilarating, twisted. This is virtuoso storytelling. Please dive in. It’s the right place and the right time.” — A. J. Finn, #1 New York Times bestselling author“A high-concept mash-up of different genres … [and] an affecting portrayal of a family careening toward crisis. The story becomes unexpectedly tender as Jen moves further back in time, in awe of the youth she let slip by so easily, and shocked by how much she did not know.” — New York Times“The story is peppered with clever, nearly impossible to predict twists, but what sets it apart is its tender portrait of marriage and motherhood.” — Washington Post“Clever, original, and so addictive it should come with a warning.” — Alice Feeney, New York Times bestselling author“Fiendishly clever and flawlessly executed, Wrong Place, Wrong Time is a staggering achievement. I could not put this novel down—it’s just dazzling.” — Rosie Walsh, New York Times bestselling author of Ghosted “Absolutely AMAZING. The plot is astonishing—original and ingenious. But it’s much more than that; the love Jen has for her son and her husband is beautiful. The stakes are so high because they’re so meaningful.” — Marian Keyes, internationally bestselling author“McAllister gives readers a chance to solve the crime from a refreshing new perspective…. This entertaining look at motherhood and memory will resonate with many." — Publishers Weekly About the Author Gillian McAllister is the New York Times bestselling author of Reese's Book Club Pick Wrong Place Wrong Time, Just Another Missing Person, Everything but the Truth, The Choice, The Good Sister, The Evidence Against You, How to Disappear, and the Richard & Judy Book Club pick That Night. She graduated with an English degree before working as a lawyer. She lives in Birmingham, England, where she now writes full-time. She is also the creator and co-host of the popular Honest Authors podcast.

body.description: INSTANT NEW YORK TIMES BESTSELLER • A REESE'S BOOK CLUB PICK“It’s perfection, every word, every moment. A masterpiece . . . One of the best books I’ve ever read.” —Lisa Jewell, #1 New York Times bestselling authorNew York Times bestselling author Gillian McAllister has created a thriller unlike any other in this endlessly clever, twisty story of a mother who must move backward through time to prevent tragedy from striking at the heart of her family.Can you stop a murder after it’s already happened?It is midnight on the morning of Halloween, and Jen anxiously waits up for her 18-year-old son, Todd, to return home. But worries about his broken curfew transform into something much more dangerous when Todd finally emerges from the darkness. As Jen watches through the window, she sees her funny, seemingly happy teenage son stab a total stranger.She doesn’t know who the victim is, or why Todd has committed such a devastating act of violence. All she knows is that her life, and Todd’s, have been shattered. After her son is taken into custody, Jen falls asleep in despair. But when she wakes up…it is yesterday. The murder has not happened yet—and there may be a chance to stop it. Each morning, when Jen wakes, she is further back in the past, first weeks, then years, before the murder. And Jen realizes that somewhere in the past lies the trigger for Todd’s terrible crime…and it is her mission to find it, and prevent it from taking place.Both the story of a mother’s love and the sacrifices she will make for her child, and a thriller with a brilliant twist, Wrong Place Wrong Time is a one-of-a-kind novel that begs to be read in one sitting.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Just Another Missing Person Wrong Place, Wrong Time

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 18, 2024
reviews.reviewText: So good! I think what I loved most was the suspense and trying to put together all the pieces mixed with such a sweet love story in the end. Usually I fall for the bad guy and don’t see his flaws as but this was the opposite. I doubted Kelly so much only to be so pleasantly surprised. If I was given a chance to go back in time and change the future, I never thought I would but this really makes me second guess that. Wouldn’t we all want to undo the bad things given the opportunity?

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 11, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Overall good read
reviews.reviewText: The first half of the book was pretty underwhelming. But I’m glad I pushed myself to finish it. The ending was worth it!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 17, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars A Challenge to go back to the past
reviews.reviewText: This book was a slow starter for me. At 41% through it, I was about to give it up, when things took a turn around. All of a sudden, the main character (Jen) is going back longer periods of time and involving more and more characters. After that, I was hooked to find out how she would turn the past around to save her family’s future. A good “who done it” book. I think my husband will also enjoy reading it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 13, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars To many jump back in time over and over.
reviews.reviewText: This book just jumped back and forth way too much! To stressful to try to keep up with who & where. I didn’t enjoy reading this book

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 29, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Well written but...
reviews.reviewText: I found it a bit predictable about halfway through. A decent read if you're looking to kill time but not a top 10 for me.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 15, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Could not put this book down! I read this in one day!! I will be looking for more books by this author.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 5, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Time travel at its best
reviews.reviewText: I was so intrigued by this concept, something like a combo of Memento and Quantum Leap (while only leaping into your own past body). The whole story was just brilliant, plenty of surprises I didn't see coming and powerful philosophical questions.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 8, 2024
reviews.reviewText: You always take chances buying secondhand but I am overall satisfied just a little shocked at the condition of a used book that was supposedly in “good” condition when several other second hand books i’ve bought have appeared much better. Overall satisfied but wish the book was marketed properly.
Diferente de los tipicos misterios pero buen libro

reviews.reviewTitle: Excelente! Super bem escrito e desenvolvido com muita criatividade e qualidade.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on February 1, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I bought this book on my kindle based on the reviews. I was a bit dubious that the plot - going back in time - was a bit far fetched but I thought I’d give it a go and boy was I glad I did. Such an intriguing idea to start with the murder and have to work your way back to what might have happened in the past to have got to this point. As humans we ponder this question often; what drives someone to take a particular action? This book explores that theme by gradually going further and further back in time, simultaneously unravelling more and more of the story. It is so intriguing. Would highly recommend.

reviews.reviewTitle: A beautiful thriller of recent times
reviews.reviewText: I randomly came across this and the title caught my curiosity. But it turned out to be one of my favourite thrillers of all time.The book starts pretty slow but soon catches on the speed. A mother, who sees her son stab a stranger. Before she could take it all in and make sense of what is happening , her son gets charged for murder. Who is the person? How can her beloved son become a murder? How could she not see? She is determined to find out answers and prove for herself and the world that her son is innocent. Instead when she wakes up it is the day before...The time travel element added to the murder mystery is a wonderful combination. The author pulls this of with such ease and keeps you guessing throughout the book. The portrayal of the intricate feelings and emotions of the characters is beautiful. I would recommend this to anyone who loves thrillers and also those who want to get started with psychological thrillers. It is a simple and interesting one without anything gory or dark.
Story is awesome, keep the pace , brilliantly written. Little over descriptive about the places
